ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] Not possible to override "max-document-download"
ygData.msgSnippet: What Stack fails to mention is that the DomainSensitiveFrontier is based on the now deprecated HostQueuesFrontier. A possible workaround for you Soren, would

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

What Stack fails to mention is that the DomainSensitiveFrontier is based on=

the now deprecated HostQueuesFrontier.
 
A possible workaround for you Sor=
en, would be to create a processor and a
filter that attaches to the scope.=

 
The processor would be somewhere after the fetch part of the chain. It w=
ould
simply tally the number of URIs that pass through for each host. It wo=
uld
also provide static access to look-ups on any of these values. Actually=
, the
StatisticsTracker does keep track of this at the moment, but you cant=
 access
the information in a useful fashion.
 
The filter (which is going t=
o be a part of the scope) would then check with
this processor for each URI=
 to see if its host has exceeded its maximum
value. The filters maximum val=
ue would be configurable and, more
importantly, overridable in the usual ma=
nner.
 
Set the Preselector to recheck scope and once a host has exceeded i=
ts max,
all other URIs belonging to it will be tossed.
 
Any other (more el=
egant) solutions would require tinkering with the
BdbFrontier.
 
- Kris

--=
---Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:arch=
ive-crawler@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of stack
Sent: 4. ma=ED 2005 15:06
T=
o: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Not possi=
ble to override
"max-document-download"


svc@... wrote:

> It would be n=
ice for us, if we could override the "max-document-download"
> setting, i.e=
 have it defined pr. domain
> We are planning to crawl a bunch of domains i=
n a single job, but need to
> set a limit to the number of objects crawled =
for each of the domains.
>
> This seems not to be possible in the current v=
ersion of heritrix.
> Maybe this could be implemented instead as a processo=
r.
> Suggestions are very welcome.

Take a look at the DomainSensitiveFront=
ier (See 
'6.1.2.3. DomainSensitveFrontier' in the User Manual 
http://craw=
ler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html#modules).  This 
frontier allows =
specification of maximum documents per domain adding a 
filter to a domain-=
specific override to prevent further downloads once 
the maximum has been r=
eached.  The DSF is based on Heritrix's previous 
default frontier, the Hos=
tQueuesFrontier so your crawls will not be as 
long lasting -- but perhaps =
it will be sufficent to your purposes (I've 
added a feature request that w=
e add this ability to the BdbFrontier:  
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/ind=
ex.php?func=3Ddetail
<http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=3Ddetai=
l&aid=3D1195298&group_id=3D7
3833&atid=3D539102).> &aid=3D1195298&group_id=
=3D73833&atid=3D539102).
St.Ack

>
> regards
> ----------------------------=
--------------------------------
